docs.lead_paragraph: An amendment to a credit card reform bill giving people the ability to pack a handgun in national parks is just the beginning of Harry Reid’s problems in holding the Democrats together.

docs.lead_paragraph: The real number of swine flu cases in the United States could be “upwards of 100,000,” but an official emphasized that most cases are mild.

docs.lead_paragraph: The idea that Barack Obama is out to win the culture wars has been kicked around since before he took office. In fact, as J.R. Dunn of American Thinker has pointed out, a desire to end the debates over contentious issues like gay marriage and the mix of religion and politics can be seen in this passage from his famous speech at the 2004 Democratic convention:
docs.abstract: Recent polls show a shift against abortion rights -- is Obama paying attention?
